title: Quinoa and Teff Sweet Potato Pizza
directions: Cut sweet potato into thin slices/circles.
Spread onto parchment paper lined baking sheet.
Drizzle olive oil, salt and pepper over sweet potato circles.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until soft and lightly browned.
While sweet potatoes are baking, wash and chop kale, garlic and onions. Cut onion into thin slices and chop or mince garlic finely.
Begin to prepare crust by combining quinoa flour, teff flour, salt, yeast and sugar in a medium sized bowl.
Add warm water and stir with a fork. Continue to stir, adding more warm water 1 Tbsp. at a time as needed until dough forms a stiff ball. (I needed 2 1/2 Tbsp. of water in addition to the 1/2 cup)
Cover bowl with a towel and let rest for 10 minutes.
Drizzle 1 Tbsp. olive oil over parchment paper on pizza dish or baking sheet.
Place dough onto oiled parchment paper and using plastic wrap flatten out into a circle or rectangle depending on the shape of your cooking sheet.
Remove plastic wrap and pre-bake dough for 8-10 minutes until golden brown.
Remove from oven and add toppings.
Reduce heat to 325 degrees and bake for an additional 3-4 minutes until toppings are heated.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon sugar (optional or use 1/4 teaspoon Stevia)
1/2 cup warm water (you may need more)
